Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: zippybuggy
Reviews.Content: I needed a second TV for my bedroom and this was on sale so I gave it a shot. The picture is very good and it has 3 HDMI inputs. The colors are very nice and the sound from the internal speakers is actually probably the best I have heard on a flat screen TV of this size (better than my Samsung that cost $200.00 more) I was really surprised by the overall picture quality. For the price you will not find a better overall TV at this price. I shopped locally at a few stores for the price this one was at and I could not find anything decent at this price. I highly recommend this TV. Shipping was free with Amazon Prime and no sales tax that saved me $30.00 + dollars !

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this tv from Target because it was on sale for 250. I wanted a tv that looked good with xbox and with functionality. This Tv has 3 HDMI ports where most high end Tvs have 2, and it doenst have that side view issue where the screen blurs and fades, color stays CRISP. The picture is amazing, i looked at all the Tvs i could and this was a close second compared to the equal specifications from Samsung which was almost $100 more. Im glad i bough this, the extra HDMI port was totally what sold me on this Tv. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to save some money and get one of the best Tvs on the market.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: K. Pomeroy
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV today and so far I love it!  Im not a hardcore gamer but I do love my video games, this tv will serve my purposes beyond my needs.  XBOX 360 seems to take well to it, sound quality from TV speakers is great.  My previous TV was a "Philips 19 inch" and I loved that tv as well.  For the price I believe you wont be disappointed and I would highly recommend this brand and product to anyone.  Long live Philips!

Reviews.Title: Who knew
Reviews.Author: papasblue
Reviews.Content: I am the winner of a Philips 32PFL3506 32-inch 720p LCD HDTV, BLACK.. and I love it !If I had not won this TV, I would not have discovered how good it is.We have been putting off buying a new TV for years, thinking "the time was not right."Also, thinking that we would just wait until our big clunker finally quit on us.What I discovered is that an exceptional TV can be had for little money.I had to set it up myself, but it was not that difficult. I would recommend this toanyone that has delayed purchasing a new TV. Had I been aware that this TVexisted, I would have gladly paid the list price thinking that this was still a very good bargain.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Debbie Szul
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would buy a TV online without first checking out the picture quality in person, but for the price, I thought I would take a chance. I am glad I did. I haven't got it hooked up to HD yet, but I know it is going to be beautiful because the digital picture is very good.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture quality, medicore menu & remote
Reviews.Author: FXP
Reviews.Content: In the end it is the picture that is the most important and this one is very good along with great surround sound.  The menu and remote control is what makes the TV easy to use and hassle free.  In this regard it is only mediocre. It seems little thought was paid to a fully functional menu system and ease of use features.  This is the skimpiest and worst menu system I have seen on a TV lately.  To give you an idea on how little thought was put into it it actually has an unused button on the remote.  I could go on but to give you an idea, the subtitles are keyed to the audio so if you hit sound mute the subtitles also go away?  Now you get programming listings not just for the current show, this one doesn't.  When the show description comes up it disappears quickly, you need to be a speed reader.  It has no time or clock feature.  It seems no thought was paid to the menu system which is an annoyance more than anything else.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: S. G. "s.g."
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these TVs (I own a bed and breakfast). They are nice and easy to learn, which is important when random people are using them every couple of days. I also really like the sound, which is better than my two Sony Bravias. The TV also looks nicer than the Sonys as it is full black, without any silver portions on the front of it (I don't know why, but the mixed silver frame just doesn't look as "sleek" to me as the total black face plate does). I liked the flat back on the TV which made it a LOT easier to mount than some of my other TVs (some, admittedly, have built in DVD players. Just a warning, when the back of the TV is anything but flat you need to use lots of plastic "shim" devices to get an adjustable wall mount to fit).I really wish they would stop including the pedestal stands with these big LCD TVs. I'd rather get $30 off and not have to add to my local landfill. Isn't the whole idea behind flats creens the fact that you can wall mount them? Well, it is in my view.We've only had these in the rooms for about 2 months, and with all products, only time will tell as to how well the TV is actually made.

Reviews.Title: Really nice "2nd" room TV
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rubenstein "Friend of Robots and Monsters"
Reviews.Content: Got two of these on Cyber Monday for the kids for Christmas. They dig it. Not great for games, because of the slower Hz there is some ghosting. TV is top heavy. Phillips recommends screwing the base into the TV stand AND provides the necessary hardware.One TV shipped without remote.

Reviews.Title: Philips 32PFL3506/F7 32-inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: Sassiebabi "Sassiebabi"
Reviews.Content: Nice tv, a little pixeled on some channels.  Directv has no remote codes for this tv.  Had a few problems connecting tv.  Went to Philips website for tech service.  "Thomas" told me to read the manual, which I had already done.  Called tech support for Philips, again spoke to "Thomas", no help.  Hard to believe Philips only has one person for tech service.  Very poor tech support.  Overall, happy with tv.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for around $250.00 for my bedroom and I am not disappointed. It has great sound and a very good picture.  I think this is the best priced 32 inch TV on the market.

Reviews.Title: Favorite TV
Reviews.Author: Ben Campbell
Reviews.Content: Set-up was simple with our AT&T; U-Verse service in our guest bedroom. The flat-panel size is light weight and assembling the base on to it was also simple. All Philips' default settings on the TV were perfect. We didn't have to tinkle with anything. We like the convenience of having 3 HDMI connections to attach other components, as well as having the USB input for videos and photos to see that I'd saved on my USB flash drive. I would purchase another 32' Philips for our bedroom but we don't want a TV in our bedroom. We have other things we like to do in there.I'm Ben Campbell. I write adventure reality/fiction novels, take photographs, which I include in my novels, and shoot full-HD 1080p video live performances of musical groups. I watch my videos on this Philips 32' 720p LCD HDTV, and can't distinguish any visual difference between full HD 1080p on my laptop and the 720p on this Philips.Enjoy your search for your perfect TV, our is this Philips.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Trend "jewelry nut"
Reviews.Content: This TV has 5 screen appearance formats available, from normal to zoom. The picture is sharp and clear.  I couldn't ask for a better picture. The color is beautiful. The sound quality is good. The volume control goes from 1 to 100, but 100 is not as loud as I imagined it would be(I purchased for someone who has difficulty hearing.If using the base stand, the TV has to be screwed onto it. Then the manufacturer suggests bolting the TV/base to the table or entertainment center you're placing it on....screws and bolts are included.  All aspects of the set up were easy.This TV serves as a replacement, after dropping the old TV and blowing out the picture tube. Though, this was an unexpected expense for me, I'm pleased the the price and quality of this TV. It certainly has a better picture quality than the old Apex I damaged.

Reviews.Title: Great TV compared to others at this price!
Reviews.Author: Glenn H.
Reviews.Content: I picked this up at Coscto for $249.99. The only other 32" TVs near this price were less known/less respected brands. Setup was a breeze, everything works exactly as expected and the picture and sound quality are great. I have three sources going into the TV. I'm running a cable directly into the TV, an up converting DVD player into an HDMI port, and a HD TiVo into an HDMI port. All sources look outstanding.

Reviews.Title: darn good tv
Reviews.Author: Jason R. Mayberry
Reviews.Content: Got my tv fast for a good price. It went up in price hours after i bought it. Tv picture is great, sound is good too. Picked up a bunch of digital channels more than my vizio 47in. Mounted on wall in bedroom looks great.Didnt have a remote in the box so amazon credited me back $30 superb customer service. Went out an got a better universal remote.

Reviews.Title: Nice little HDTV
Reviews.Author: Travis R.
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this TV at a Sams club near my home for a great price. I was a little apprehensive about the purchase because I had my mind set on a samsung. After comparing the two televisions I had to go with the Phillips. The picture on both the Samsung and the Phillips are great. Samsung would take the edge over this TV's picture but only slightly. The Phillips TV offers more inputs and audio outs than the Samsung and was about 60 dollars cheaper than the Samsung which is why I ended up going with this TV. So far the TV has been great. I have it hooked up to my att uverse cable with HDMI and the picture on the HD channels is great! even on non HD channels the picture is much better than any of the older tube tv's in my house. This is my first ever flat screen tv and so far it has been great. I wish it had a 2 year warranty rather than a 1 year but with sams club's warranty I can get up to a 3 year protection plan! I would recommend this tv to anyone on a budget looking for a great little HDTV for their room.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Descent For The Price
Reviews.Author: Dudester55
Reviews.Content: After comparing apples to apples and oranges to oranges the last couple of weeks, I decided to purchase this Phillips 32" HDTV model 3506. I have a 50" Panasonic Viera in the playroom, which is awesome, and the 32" Phillips doesn't have quite the same quality as the Panny, but for it's price, it has very respectable image....especially in HD. Set up was a breeze, and to be honest, idiot proof.I'm a little disappointed about the standard definition on this TV, but I'm not crazy about the standard definition on the HDTV that is hooked up to Bell satellite...so all is fair in that regards. The internal speakers of the Philips sound is quite impressive for this Phillips model, compared to my sisters Sony Bravia internal speakers, which sound like a cheap transistor radio. The Phillips can be heard clearly and easily, without having to adjust the volume between commercials or channel flipping from on channel to another. So all in all, I'm quite happy with this hdtv for the price, however time will tell how long it'll keep on running great. For now, my hat goes off to Phillips, for making a decent quality TV for a reasonable price. Just don't compare this tv to a Panasonic or Samsung, then again, you'll pay much more for the latter brands of same size. For a bedroom tv, the Phillips is the wise choice to buy. We simply watch the late night news with it, and then maybe a late night talk show or movie, then it's lights out. Should last a long time, or at least, that's my expectation....lets hope I'm right. I would recommend this hdtv for bedroom or office....anything more expensive would just be overkill and money thrown out the window.

Reviews.Title: Solid Overall TV
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Lors
Reviews.Content: Picture on this tv is great. Very clear, and watching HD cable tv or a blu-ray movie are breathtakingly beautiful. The remote is horrible (read very basic), the sound is decent.So why did i give it 5 stars??? Well, I never really found a stock remote that I like. I expect them to be basic. If you'd like something more extravagant, you might need to visit your local best buy. As far as the sound, it's nothing to rant and rave about. I have a set of bose companion 2's that I plug in there and the sound just fills up my little room. It's actually quite impressive. Back to why the tv still deserves 5 stars. Aside from the large projection tv's, how often have you heard great sound from a tv? Exactly. It stacks up well against the competition.

Reviews.Title: Philips 32PFL3506/32 in 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: A. M. Cheung
Reviews.Content: Excellent unit well designed.  Great colors with very sharp image resolution, well balanced surround sound, and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Danly
Reviews.Content: One of the best TVs I have ever owned. Crystal clear image and great sound. Love to watch HD movies, and play PS3 on this TV. Would recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: JUST RIGHT !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Charlotte "Char"
Reviews.Content: Bedroom is small, This 32" Phillips HDTV is perfect. Worked GREAT straight out of the box too. We love it!!

Reviews.Title: not what it seems
Reviews.Author: kman
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled from all the good reviews like I was.This tv picture does NOT stand up to time.I ownd two of em and both has same problem about four months in and by seven months its damn near busted.lack of sharpness,wavy lines and static lines among other issues all formed in both

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: AnjelB
Reviews.Content: This was actually a great purchase.  I have only Samsung tvs in my home but this one had a great price and I'm glad I purchased it.  My son uses this for gaming in his room and the graphics show up extremely well!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: J-Mel
Reviews.Content: This TV has fantastic picture quality, great sound and is fully adjustable for everything. The other TV's I looked at with 200-300 reviews with an average of 4 1/2 stars seemed good...but I felt this one had better sound quality and functionality after comparing and it sure does in my experience. Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Lal Jay
Reviews.Content: Philips 32PFL3506/F7 32-inch 720p LCD HDTV, BlackThis was the cheapest of this size TV with a recognised brand name. But it had very good custommer reviews. I desided to buy this based on those reviews using my amazon gift card. It was at my door step within 2 days even though I selected normal delivery. The picture and sound is amazing for the prize I paid. I am still looking for a catch since it was dirt cheap but so far so good. But later I saw a review which says this TV is prawn to break down after one year. Ok I'm going to get an extended warranty for $39 which will replace the TV with new one within first 2 years. After that if it breaks.....? Goes to the dumpster.

Reviews.Title: cheaper at target
Reviews.Author: los panda
Reviews.Content: i bought this puppy at target for 280 and got the usual 5% off with the target card. the picture is stunning, the sound is good, i highly recommend this tv. i can't find anything comparable for the price. do yourself a favor and bag it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: ** Philips 32" LCD ***
Reviews.Author: B. Kaiser "B. V. Kaiser"
Reviews.Content: Just installed this TV on the wall. Had to figure out what wall mount screw holes to use as there is no mention of installation in the manual. No biggie as I found them. Picture is nice (digital) as it is just hooked up to cable. No cable box hence no HD. It's installed in our workout room so HD isn't a priority. Easy tv menu lead installation and setup. Sound, looks, and picture are just fine. I can recommend this TV for a den, workout room, etc. I suspect if it was hooked up to recieve HD from a Blu-Ray, the picture would be great. Of course you always find it cheaper AFTER you buy it. :) Philips 32PFL3506/F7 32-inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black

Reviews.Title: Phillips HDTV
Reviews.Author: Hellen
Reviews.Content: Light weight, but solid. Crisp clear picture. Wish it had a tv guide option, but other than that enjoying very much.

Reviews.Title: Cheapie TV works great for bedroom
Reviews.Author: Peter Mcmillan
Reviews.Content: I paid somewhat less than the current advertised price, and for that it was a bargain. Perfect replacement for the 27" we bought back in 2004 which suddenly stopped working. If I get 9 years of use out of this one I will be happy indeed. There's not that much to say about flat screen tvs at this size and price - they all seem to look similar to me, and a little tweaking of the settings allows you to get it looking how you want. Sound is perfectly adequate for a bedroom, picture is visible in bright daylight, remote is simple and gets the job done. A couple of screws to put on the stand and you're done.

Reviews.Title: It broke!
Reviews.Author: andyt
Reviews.Content: Picture was great, audio was okay. Worked for just under 1 year, then the picture went out. "Known problem". Hrmmm.Philips has been great about the return (after 3 weeks, and a 1 week delay because I printed the "wrong" invoice), and I'm awaiting the replacement, but this was a huge hassle.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV-Great Price
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a mid-range size TV. This one stood out to me due to the quality/price ratio. Bought the TV about two months ago- haven't been disappointed- you will not be either.The picture quality of this TV is outstanding. I am still impressed by the clarity every time I turn it on. This fact is even more significant when it is more clear than my 60".If audio is important to you-speakers may be essential. The built-in speakers have decent volume, but both quality and volume are impacted by the speakers location-in the back.If you are thinking of whether or not to pull the trigger and go this this TV, think no longer. The quality of the machine will not make you re-think your decision. There are 4 HMDI inputs  to plug all of your toys into-so you can plug into your new toy.

Reviews.Title: My 2nd Philips television
Reviews.Author: R. Williams "R. Williams"
Reviews.Content: This is my  second television purchased from Philips. The first one is not a flat panel, although it looks like one. I have had it for over ten years.I love this hdtv, it shows a beautiful picture, and it has a remarkable sound. I would reccomend Philips product to anyone who asks.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: ronald m. coffin
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with a flat screen tv. I found it to have a great picture and great features such as the USB port although you are limited to the format of the file content. The downside of this tv is poor quality in the sound also very tippy needs to be secured to surface or wall. Overall a great value for anyone looking for a flatscreen tv.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: jessica
Reviews.Content: Bought this for our bed room, and am extremely happy with my purchase, and shipping was fast! No problem with brightness, it gives you setup options at the beginning that are extremely easy, and the sound and picture are great as well i also like how it has more than one HDMI port and a USB port! Me and my boyfriend are very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Damarr D Doyle
Reviews.Content: This television comes as advertised. Quality sound and picture. Easy to setup. Would recommend to family and friends. Great television for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Lisa M Pearson
Reviews.Content: Wonderful TV for the price. Works perfect. Easy to set up. Nice looking. GREAT deal, best I could find for under 300$.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Melody C. Krusz "Melvis"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV and think it has an amazingly clear picture, great color, easy setup and good sound.  I couldn't be happier especially for the size and price.

Reviews.Title: Philips 32PFL3506/F7
Reviews.Author: bluedolphin671
Reviews.Content: I originally bought a Haier 32inch six months ago. And was completely dissatisfied. Upon returning the Haier I purchased the Philips 32PFL3506/F7 32 And there is nothing to say other then good things about this t.v. .Very happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Easier than Expected.
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: Set up took 15 minutes.  The owner's manual is near worthless so it is a good thing that the menu settings are very intuitive and offer on screen explanations as to what you are setting.  I have DVD, antenna, and VCR up and running in less than 1/2 hour, and I am an old geezer.The picture is great; they all are.  The remote is OK.  A bonus; my universal remote that was set for a very old Philips CRT worked with no adjustments on this new Philips.  Also, this model has inputs for component and composite as well as S-video.  All my old style video stuff works just fine.  Watch out for all these inputs as many newer models leave them off.It looks as though Philips has sold off their TV division and I have been told that they no longer make their own televisions ( I see this has been confirmed).  That is too bad, as they were one of the last of the big names you could rely on.  Such is the way things are going, I guess some of the bigger names are losing money on every flat screen sold.This is LCD and the trend is to LED.  It is next to impossible to see any difference and even though LED light sources are said to last longer, LCDs seem to do just fine and there are some significant discounts on this TV as the newer LED models are coming out.  For the right price, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: big screen, small titles, slow responses, rotten remote
Reviews.Author: chips
Reviews.Content: this tv is very slow starting and changing channels and the remote works about half the time. the titles are very small and i need to get very close to the screen to read them. i wont buy this brand again

Reviews.Title: Hope it will last long.
Reviews.Author: R. Corpus
Reviews.Content: Received this product the next day with Prime membership. Easy to set up and get up and running right away. Picture quality is great! Sound is pretty amazing for the price I paid for this as well.Only reason I gave this 3 stars is because of the smell. You know how when something eletrical burns out, it gives out a certain smell. As soon as I opened the box, I could smell it like something was burnt inside the TV. I am hoping I didn't get a defective product, but we'll see how long this will last.

Reviews.Title: Awful
Reviews.Author: William Johnston
Reviews.Content: This was the last time I will ever purchase anything from Philips. The TV was a piece of junk. Everytime I tried to change the channel, increase the volume, pause a movie, listen to an internet streaming music service, or a number of other things the TV would go black for three to five seconds then display the word "Philips" before performing the desired task. I looked online for solutions and, while I didn't find any, I did see that there were lots of people who have had similar problems--some even worse. It did this straight out of the box and became more frequent over the course of the two weeks I had it. I returned it, bought another brand and all is well. I have had bad experiences with Philips before but this sealed the deal: never again.FYI: some of you may not be aware that employees of these companies neg bad reviews automatically. My review is 100% factual and Philips or anyone else connected financially with the sale of this television ought to contact posters of bad reviews and apologize rather than mark honest reviews as unhelpful. I personally could not care less about an "unhelpful vote" but there are Amazon customers who are unaware of the games played by these companies and so might be swayed into dropping their hard-earned cash on a bad product because of it.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE
Reviews.Author: Toby
Reviews.Content: had tv for a year now ,never had a problem with it till now, does not turn on,if it does powers off and dont do anything. Contacted phillips and said that it is a common problem with this model and that they can not do anything about it unless you have warranty do not purchase waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Broken when arrived
Reviews.Author: mineolacoffee
Reviews.Content: We ordered the TV and will have to return it as the picture has a defect in the screen. Don't know how that will go I hope they will be reasonable about it

Reviews.Title: Ubuntu Love
Reviews.Author: Wolf Tactical Blogs
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheap large screen to watch movies or work on excel sheets this is the screen. I am using this via a VGA converter from Rosewill. This screen dosent have any lag at all whether your watching Youtube or a MKV file via VLC. This screen is outstanding and light.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture!
Reviews.Author: Fizgig
Reviews.Content: Pros:* The picture on this TV is fantastic straight out of the box before making any adjustments.  Even though it's supposed to max. out at 720p, I'm getting many 1080p channels.  In the store I got it from, they had the TV on display alongside an LED Samsung and the picture on this TV was even better than the LED Samsung of the same size.* The tuner is excellent, too!  Picked up 120+ channels in 5 minutes.* All the settings are easy to get to even without the use of a manual.  All settings are FULLY customizable to create a "home" profile plus there are several presets that are very good for both picture quality and sound.* Very light weight with very stable base (screws provided to secure base to surface TV sits on, but it's not really necessary to use them in my opinion unless you have kids or worry about the TV being tipped for some other similar reason).* Simple remote!* Quick access buttons on remote to change between picture and sound profiles without having to go into the full menu for those options.* Great sound for a small sized TV!  Fully accessible/customizable EQ controls plus 4-5 presets.  I hooked mine into an Aiwa home theater system to get fuller/richer sound for movies & such, but for basic viewing the built in sound is excellent.  I did watch a movie with just the built in sound and it was very good -- I just have a personal preference for full rich sound.My Cons:* I really wish the remote had LED lights....  The based color of the remote is black, the buttons are grey, the text/writing on the remote is white/light grey.  Very difficult to work with in a dark room without turning on lights.* Slow to switch channels.  There's a 1-3 second delay between the channel switch and the channel actually coming in.  This doesn't bother me, frankly, but I can see where some would be annoyed by it.  From what I've seen with other sets this size, it's about the same across the board.IMO & IME, the pros far outweigh the minor cons & don't effect the functionality of the TV.  I saw the set alongside 10 or so others in the same size category and it really stood out for picture quality -- even trumped LED sets.  My parents have a Panasonic Viera (purchased in 2012) in the same size and the picture quality on that is inferior to this Phillips (quite the price difference too!).  One of my clients has a Sony Bravia (purchased in 2012) in the same size as this Phillips and the picture is FAR inferior on that compared to this Phillips.  Would not hesitate to recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Awesomely Average
Reviews.Author: Hermin Hollerith, Maker of Tacky Wreaths in t...
Reviews.Content: Summary for those who don't like to read:  4 stars based on price and performance; doesn't knock your socks off but does a great job for the price.  Pretty close in performance to similarly sized 720p Samsung TVs costing $100 more.This is an exceptional TV in terms of price and features.  It is far from perfect and it comes out of the box configured to perform as nothing but mediocre.  But if you're willing to take the time to set it up to your personal tastes, you'll have a great TV for the price.This TV has great viewing angles that rival much more expensive models from competitors like Samsung, with solid performance below the center of the set (in case you like to watch TV from the floor) as well as to the sides.  The only color shifting and picture distortion happens when viewing off the corners above and below (a very odd place to be watching TV).Out of the box, the audio on this set stinks.  This is due in part to cheap speakers, but it is also due to the configuration that sets the default audio profile to something resembling a 1980's RCA portable color TV.  I'm not making this up, it sounds just like that.  While I'm a fan of retro electronics, I didn't expect my LCD TV to sound this way.  Fortunately, you can fix that with some tweaks in the audio section of the configuration that permits you to equalize the audio to your tastes.  While that doesn't make the cheap tiny speakers suddenly something by Bose, it does make the sound coming out of this TV waaaaaay better.  More than just tolerable, in my opinion.Similarly, the brightness and contrast on the set are have a default configuration that is, well, awful.  My first impressions after taking it out of the box and getting the channels scanned was "wow, that's not what I saw in the store".  The contrast setting makes any scene on TV with a high luminance background and say, a weather forecaster wearing a dark suit while on the chroma key, just painful.  Again, the menu has a configuration with some presets that make the video much better, or you can delve into your own contrast, brightness, color temp settings and season the look to your own tastes.  No, it won't look like that $2200 70" LED Sony no matter what you do to it (aside from taking it back to the store and exchanging it for the $2200 Sony), but it does look pretty good.There's three HDMI inputs, component inputs (YPBPR, analog NTS), and the tuner does a nice fast job of scanning for clear QAM and analog channels.  There's also coaxial digital and analog audio outputs, something the Samsung used as a comparison surprisingly lacked.Four stars for being a solid yet inexpensive TV.  Take the time to set it up to your tastes and I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: You will go INSANE with the SLOW channel changing...
Reviews.Author: SoCalGal
Reviews.Content: I could mention more annoyances with this TV, but I just can't get over the horribly slow channel changing.Really, imagine clicking channel up, then waiting...first, you'll see a black screen , then this text 'Channel Search'...wait, now back to black (if the channel is not viewable) or you might finally see your show. Really, 4-5 seconds for EACH channel change?Don't expect a normal, comfortable channel-surfing experience. ARGHHHH!'

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: TSVETELINA "Ft.Lauderdale, FL"
Reviews.Content: Bought it for $200 during some promotion last year in April.Haven't had any issues with it or complains. Great deal

Reviews.Title: Phillips TV
Reviews.Author: Penny McGhee
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV, bright, clear.  It was a super buy!  I would buy it again in a skinny minute if I needed another TV!

Reviews.Title: Good Basic TV
Reviews.Author: Diane D. Rollins
Reviews.Content: The TV works great, light weight, so easy to move from room to room if I want and the clarity is good.  A nice basic TV

Reviews.Title: wonderful television
Reviews.Author: Heather L. Heise-reeves

Reviews.Title: Dead pixel, cheesy remote, marks on bezel
Reviews.Author: M. Erb
Reviews.Content: My requirements for an HDTV were modest. I did not want to spend more than $300, I would be happy with 720p and I wanted to make sure the TV had at least 2 HDMI ports and audio out for external speakers.As I began researching I found this Philips 32" HDTV as a refurb. I'd had good experiences in the past purchasing refurbished electronics so I decided to take a chance on the Philips HDTV refurb.As soon as I opened the box I was beginning to have second thoughts. The paper manual was in rough shape as if it had been handled previously (perhaps by a previous owner which is why the unit was refurbished???)The remote control felt very light and flimsy in the hand. No batteries were included which is not a big deal but I'm just relaying my experience. The TV Stand was already attached to the TV but it did not swivel or tilt at all.The bezel had a protective plastic film over it but when I removed the film the plastic was marked up pretty badly and was very noticeable... it detracted from the appearance of the TV.Most disturbing was the stuck pixel just about smack dab in the middle of the screen. It was such a bright and pointed light when viewing a dark background that I found it extremely obnoxious and that alone was reason enough to return the TV.Before returning the set I did go through the entire setup process. It was easy to select the language, choose antenna or cable then choose auto to discover analog and digital channels. Once it was ready to go I observed the quality of picture on both Analog, Digital and from DVD and was not overly impressed. There was a lot of blooming with some colors. I realize this is 720p but I did notice pixelation and an overall lack of sharpness in the image.Audio was not great either. Sufficient but not great. The speakers are not forward positioned so the sound is not directional towards you but sort of bounces out from underneath and behind the TV.I was expecting better in light of the mostly positive reviews of the TV from other users. Even if the LCD screen had not had the defective pixel, I still would not rate this TV very well as the screen sharpness was not great, although the viewing angle was quite good compared to other low-end HDTV's I'd seen. And screen brightness was pretty good. But my overall sense was not overly positive and the sound was not very good, certainly not nearly as good as the HDTV I ultimately bought, the Vizio E321VL 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV - Black. The Vizio is superior in every way compared to the Philips. Of course, it does cost a bit more, but in my opinion the quality far surpasses that of the Philips. Build quality, sound quality, speed of switching channels and even the remote is more substantial feeling.The Philips refurb was very disappointing. I recognize that I might have just received a "lemon" but in my experience with this TV I cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: a great deal for the price
Reviews.Author: Irishlady
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for <300$ including shipping. I had to give it 5 stars because the quality of the picture for the price I paid is quite good, plus I like that it has 3 HDMI ports. The picture is even better on non-high-def channels than my old Samsung 24 inch LCD that this one replaced. The viewing angles are better, too. It's amazing how picture quality has gone up in the last few years while prices have gone down. Like others have said, the remote has few features, but I use my Directv remote for most functions anyway. One thing that bothers me (a little) is the bezel--it's pretty big on this TV.The warranty is standard 1 year. Overall, I am pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!!! Stop whining about n!!!
Reviews.Author: NorCaliGurl
Reviews.Content: I rarely leave reviews on amazon or anywhere online but I couldn't resist on this product. And to top it off, I didn't even buy this Tv on Amazon. I got mine from COSTCO for $239.99 before taxes (which would probably be equal to the current offer of amazon of $270+ with PrimeFree shipping).. I've had this tv for a week now and I LOVE IT!! I used to have the OLD BIG FAT HEAVY TV and I had some extra money so I decided to get a new tv I've been wanting. Went to costco and was choosinh between this and a Vizio ($249.99) same 32" and same features. I googled both before buyinh and saw that the original price for this was $380.. WOW!! What a discount.. Same size and features compared to Vizio, but knowing Philips is a trusted brand, I went with what my guts told me and boy did I make the perfect decision!Yes, I can start whining like someReviewers here about the REMOTE or the SIMPLE MENU/SETTINGS, but C'mon what more do you expect?? Might as well buy a $500 Smart TV.. Yes remote couldve been more thought of but as long as it does the job then I'm all good.. The menu is very easy and understandable. Other than that EVERYTHING LOOKS GREAT. Picture quality even with Non-HD Channels look great. Sound quality is awesome. My room is quite small so the size is just PERFECT.. I recommend this TV a lot.. I know my mom is jealous of my new tv so I might wait for Labor Day sale and hope stores have this in stock..I hope my story & review helped you with your decision on this TV. Try going to nearby electronic stores and see if they have a better deal. Costco definitely has one.

Reviews.Title: crap
Reviews.Author: Brad Lovett Cohen "claymate26"
Reviews.Content: This is the second Philips that I have had.The first I cut off one night and the next morning it would not cut back on.It was under warranty,so I took it back to Target.They didn't have any more,so I ordered this one.This one lasted all of two months before the picture went bad.It just one day started going bright and we tried everything to fix it.We called customer support,they said it was under warranty and that they would send us another one.Oh they did alright,one that was older then my brand new one and this one has picture problems as well,the picture is kinda fuzzy and not quite clear. The idiot at customer service said that we would have to download a program on a memory stick to get it to clear up.?! WTH? I have never heard such BS. If I could give less then one star I would. This tv has been nothing but trouble. Stear clear. They will only send you a factory refurbished for you brand new one. That being said,we have had a VIZIO for over a year and it has worked fine. I might as well have set my 300.00 on fire.This tv is BS.

Reviews.Title: loving it
Reviews.Author: ItsyBitsysMommy
Reviews.Content: we had a 22in rca lcd flat screen in our front room. i measured the entertainment cabinet wrong. from where the cabinet is to the sofa is a good distance. it made seeing and hearing the 22in rca hard.after remeasuring the cabinet i started looking for a 32in lcd flat screen. ive never had a problem with Philips products. the price was within range and i thought very reasonable for this tv.we have had it set up and been using it for about four days now. the picture quality is vibrant and clear. no muddy colors or pixel noise. the speaker/s are great. its very loud and clear.the options set up was very user friendly and fast.the one con i found is why this model got 4 stars, not 5. the manual stresses securing the tv by screwing it to the stand if you're not mounting it. i was not crazy about putting holes in my entertainment center. however, two holes is a small price to pay if it prevents an accident fatal to the tv. the problem is with securin the stand.the tv locks into its stand and then you screw the stand in place. then you are suppose to screw the stand into the serface the tv will sit on. i have about three, maybe four inches of clearance between the tv and my entertainment cabinets walls. the screw holes to secure the tv to the surface are centered on the back of the stand base. in order to get both screws in i would have to move a very heavy entertainment center out, cut a hole in the backing or pull the backing off, put the tv in, screw it down THEN move the entertainment center back into place which would jostle the tv.i was only able to get one screw in by reaching around from the front, and not entirely. so, i put a 1/4th in. plastic wedge under the tv. this tilts it back ever so slightly. that way if something happens (i.e. we bump the cabinet or the door gets left open and one of the cats jump in to rub on the tv) the tv will tip about three inches back and tap into the rear of the entertainment cabinet. causing no signifigant damage vs falling out of the entertainment center.considering how common entertainment cabinets are, this is a glaringly obvious design flaw. one that creats a safety hazard and could lead to signifigant damage to the tv. two screw holes should have been put in the back and the front. or two on the sides in front of the screen. if its an aesthetic issue with seeing screw holes then charge a couple dollars more and include some caps.it really is a great tv and if not for the one issue i would have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: This TV had burnt circuit inside
Reviews.Author: Vincent
Reviews.Content: This TV had burnt electronics inside the TV should always boot smell burning and about 2 hours after the TV automatically switches off. So very sad when I bought this TV mistaken

Reviews.Title: USB port useless I'm returning this
Reviews.Author: Mark W. Roberts
Reviews.Content: Ok so my wife and I finally bought a flat screen and we just looked at BJ's where we buy 80% of everything. She went back and forth about having the DVD player built in I wanted USB. (when I learned they had it)What I did not realize is that I can't just plug in my external HD and watch the stuff i download.  Why?  These USB ports are only for fat32 drives. So sure, you can plug in a USB drive but only one that will not hold anything but a 4gb file no bigger.  A frigging bugs bunny cartoon is bigger than that.Why do I have to watch stuff I download?  NO MORE DVDs everywhere getting scratched and taking up space they suck.  Having digital media on a HD is WAY better and eventually it'll all b like that.So I called and Philips told me about a program that lets you hook your tv to the computer using WIFI but guess what this one has no WIFI so back it goes.  It's behind the times, get one with WIFI at least you'll b glad you did.The only way I won't return it is if the ones with the capability i want are MUCH more expensive.BTW there is no HDMI cable in the box and they are 29 bucks, no one working at BJ's would b able tor interested in telling you that.

Reviews.Content: I bought two of these back in april when moving into a new home.  The price was right for the size I was looking for.When bringing them home, one of the tv's wouldn't even turn on.  It was promptly returned and exchanged for a different make/model.  The other tv was working fine until this past week, the TV is currently unresponsive to the remote and the buttons on the tv itself.  It's useless.Piece of junk, avoid.

Reviews.Title: Price came down. Have bought it. Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: S. Adams "S. Adams"
Reviews.Content: This looks like a good little TV, but the price increased greatly since before Christmas. I would buy it at the pre-Christmas price of $250.00, but at this price I think I will consider a TCL with more feedback and a two year warranty. Pity. I would have preferred the lower price and then I could have gotten a 3 year Square Trade warranty to buffer my purchase. I will keep an eye on this for the next few days before I make my final decision. I am giving it 3 stars for the massive, sudden hike in price.Update: Thanks to David Miller for the reminder, this review was due for an update. The price did come down, as it tends to when one makes an issue of it on Amazon - especially when there is an intention to purchase stated in the complaint. I have used this tactic several times now and it has paid off every time so far (3 times now, I think). And I am very glad I complained and then followed through on my intention to purchase this item. I bought it on Jan. 17th, 12 days after posting my initial complaint about the huge price hike.This is a wonderful TV with great, easy to use features. The most important to me were that it has a truly great picture that is easily tweaked to my preferred specs. Also, it boasts 3 HDMI ports, one of which is conveniently located on the side, along with a USB port. It also has RCA inputs and component inputs, as well as an S-video input. All in all, I can hook just about anything up to this little gem of a TV! Overall, I am not as enamored of the sound quality from the unit as some of the other reviewers seem to be, but it really is better than what most other TVs give off, so that's just fine too.The controls and functions are very user-friendly and it takes no time at all to be cruising along smoothly, switching from one input to another.I have been shopping for a second TV for the upstairs bedroom and I have yet to find one that compares to this one for price, quality and features. I may very well be buying a second one very soon... as soon as the price comes down some more... ;)
